page.title: 01A Scattered rural community
page.content: Ellisfield one of the highest villages in Hampshire off the Old Harrow Way situated approximately five miles from Basingstoke. Originally a farming community, the village has become more of a dormitory for Basingstoke and even London. The village has an extensive boundary with a very rural aspect consisting of farmland and a great deal fo mixed forestry. The twin focal points are the village church and the pub, the Fox Inn. The village also has a large number of listed buildings of typical Hampshire style. There are comparitively few arranged amenities and many services such as gas and mains drainage are absent
